articles.content: The New Left does not portend a revolution, as its press agents claim, but a Putsch. A revolution is the climax of a long philosophical development and expresses a nation’s profound discontent; a Putsch is a minority’s seizure of power. The goal of a revolution is to overthrow tyranny; the goal of a Putsch is to establish it.
articles.attribution:
“From a Symposium,”
Return of the Primitive: The Anti-Industrial Revolution, 173
